# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is an implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    result = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result) && line_length != 0 # Not the first word of a line
            result *= " "
            line_length += 1
        end
        result *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.", 20))
```
This will output the following:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum\ndolor sit amet,\nconsectetur adipiscing elit.\nSed do eiusmod tempor\nincididunt ut labore et\ndolore magna aliqua."
```
